feat(observability): add audit validation targets and feedback schema improvements

Problem:
- Missing Makefile targets for validating audit and feedback ledgers
- feedback_event_v1.json schema lacked proper validation for optional fields
- observability/audit/ missing __init__.py for proper module structure

Solution:
- Added audit-validate-ledger target to Makefile
  - Validates audit_logs/ledger.jsonl against schemas/audit_event_v1.json
  - Python-based validation with jsonschema library
  - Provides clear success/failure feedback
  
- Added feedback-validate target to Makefile
  - Validates feedback_logs/*.jsonl against schemas/feedback_event_v1.json
  - Same validation pattern as audit ledgers
  
- Updated schemas/feedback_event_v1.json
  - Improved nullable field handling
  - Added proper type constraints
  - Better validation for feedback events
  
- Created observability/audit/__init__.py
  - Proper Python module structure for audit subpackage
  - Enables clean imports from observability.audit

Impact:
- Complete audit trail validation workflow
- Feedback event schema validation
- T4/0.01% quality standards for ledger integrity
- Easy validation with: make audit-validate-ledger, make feedback-validate

Technical Details:
- Makefile targets use Python jsonschema validation
- Single-line Python execution for simplicity
- Validates all JSONL events against JSON Schema v2020-12
- Clear success messages for validation pass

Files Modified (2):
- Makefile: +audit-validate-ledger and +feedback-validate targets
- schemas/feedback_event_v1.json: Improved nullable field handling

Files Created (1):
- observability/audit/__init__.py: Module structure
